org.bytedeco.liquidfun

Class b2DynamicTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.liquidfun.b2DynamicTree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    @NoOffset
 @Properties(inherit=liquidfun.class)
public class b2DynamicTree
extends Pointer
    A dynamic AABB tree broad-phase, inspired by Nathanael Presson's btDbvt. A dynamic tree arranges data in a binary tree to accelerate queries such as volume queries and ray casts. Leafs are proxies with an AABB. In the tree we expand the proxy AABB by b2_fatAABBFactor so that the proxy AABB is bigger than the client object. This allows the client object to move by small amounts without triggering a tree update. Nodes are pooled and relocatable, so we use node indices rather than pointers.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • MoveProxy

        @Cast(value="bool")
public boolean MoveProxy(@Cast(value="int32")
                                             int proxyId,
                                             @Const @ByRef
                                             b2AABB aabb1,
                                             @Const @ByRef
                                             b2Vec2 displacement)
        Move a proxy with a swepted AABB. If the proxy has moved outside of its fattened AABB, then the proxy is removed from the tree and re-inserted. Otherwise the function returns immediately.
        Returns:
        true if the proxy was re-inserted.

        Returns:
        the proxy user data or 0 if the id is invalid.

      • Query

        @Name(value="Query<b2DynamicTreeQueryCallback>")
public void Query(b2DynamicTreeQueryCallback callback,
                                                                   @Const @ByRef
                                                                   b2AABB aabb)
        Query an AABB for overlapping proxies. The callback class is called for each proxy that overlaps the supplied AABB.

      • RayCast

        @Name(value="RayCast<b2DynamicTreeRayCastCallback>")
public void RayCast(b2DynamicTreeRayCastCallback callback,
                                                                         @Const @ByRef
                                                                         b2RayCastInput input)
        Ray-cast against the proxies in the tree. This relies on the callback to perform a exact ray-cast in the case were the proxy contains a shape. The callback also performs the any collision filtering. This has performance roughly equal to k * log(n), where k is the number of collisions and n is the number of proxies in the tree.
        Parameters:
        input - the ray-cast input data. The ray extends from p1 to p1 + maxFraction * (p2 - p1).
        callback - a callback class that is called for each proxy that is hit by the ray.

      • Validate

        public void Validate()
        Validate this tree. For testing.

      • GetHeight

        @Cast(value="int32")
public int GetHeight()
        Compute the height of the binary tree in O(N) time. Should not be called often.

      • GetMaxBalance

        @Cast(value="int32")
public int GetMaxBalance()
        Get the maximum balance of an node in the tree. The balance is the difference in height of the two children of a node.

      • GetAreaRatio

        @Cast(value="float32")
public float GetAreaRatio()
        Get the ratio of the sum of the node areas to the root area.

      • RebuildBottomUp

        public void RebuildBottomUp()
        Build an optimal tree. Very expensive. For testing.

      • ShiftOrigin

        public void ShiftOrigin(@Const @ByRef
                        b2Vec2 newOrigin)
        Shift the world origin. Useful for large worlds. The shift formula is: position -= newOrigin
        Parameters:
        newOrigin - the new origin with respect to the old origin
